description: Dive into "Whispers of Love in Dubrovnik" — a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Whispers of Love in Dubrovnik

places.generalDescription: Restaurant Panorama offers breathtaking views of Dubrovnik, situated atop a mountain and overlooking the Old Town and the Adriatic Sea. It is part of the Nautika Collection, which includes two other remarkable restaurants in Dubrovnik. The restaurant provides an enchanting dining experience with typical Croatian cuisine, including meat, fish, pasta, pizza, and risotto. To secure a table with a view, it's advisable to make reservations in advance or visit during off-peak hours.

sources.snippet: Having a meal on top of the city is truly an incredible experience, when you are surrounded only by nature and clear blue sky. An indescribable field of a view looking at the stunning old town of Dubrovnik with a wide-open horizon, where the sky seems to touch the sea. Can you imagine all this in one place?
sources.shortName: Romantic | Dubrovnik Eats

sources.snippet: The Panorama Restaurant at the summit could be the perfect spot to celebrate the moment. Alternatively, the ancient city walls provide a stunning setting during sunset, offering a view that stretches across the old town and the shimmering sea.
sources.shortName: Romantic Dubrovnik Proposal Ideas for Your Vacation
15 Best Romantic Things to Do in Dubrovnik for Couples

places.name: Restaurant Panorama

reviews.text: A very special experience. We managed to get front row seats by booking our reservation at off peak hours of 4:30pm as a group of 14. Our server Peter was amazing and they have a large staff who are very attentive. The food and cocktail presentation were divine! The views are incredible. Everyone in our group was delighted with their meal. A meal to remember!

I booked a table over a month in advance (peak season) and could only get a second row late lunch table available so make sure to book well in advance! However when we arrived we were advised that they were able to upgrade us to front row. The front row experience was amazing, the views incredible, especially at sunset. I was hoping the restaurant wouldn't be an overpriced touristy gimmick, but it certainly wasn't. While the food/ drink was expensive, it was worth it for the views, great servers and amazing food! This is a must do experience in Dubrovnik, there was even free DJ and face painting from 7pm right next to the restaurant and the cable car ride was pretty cool too!

Although this was definitely the most expensive of our meals (due to being reached by cable car), not many, if any, could offer a similar view. We arranged our visit to coincide with sunset, several months before and we were not disappointed, nor were we with the food.

Selection, service and quality were all exceptional, as well as the waiters knowledge of the wine list.

This is definitely an experience worth doing and one that will stay with you forever.

places.generalDescription: A visit to the iconic Dubrovnik City Walls is an absolute must for anyone exploring this stunning coastal gem. Stretching nearly 1,940 meters, these impressive fortifications are among Europe’s finest and feature a mix of round towers, rectangular fortresses, and bastions that date back to the 15th century. As you ascend the main stairway on the western side, you'll be greeted with breathtaking views of both the vibrant Old Town and the sparkling Adriatic Sea.

sources.shortName: 15 Best Romantic Things to Do in Dubrovnik for Couples

places.name: Dubrovnik City Walls

reviews.text: Great way to see the whole of the Old Town and views out to sea. Would definitely recommend if you're visiting Dubrovnik. It's worth getting the Dubrovnik Pass which will allow you access to the Walls and many other activities/sites in Dubrovnik.

The 'must do' thing when you are in Dubrovnik. On a good day you can see for miles from the top of the walls and it is probably the best place to view the old city buildings from.

There are really nice views of Fort Lovrijenac from the walls and you can spot lots of Game of Thrones filming locations from them. Highly recommended and don't forget that the price includes a visit to Lovrijenac as well.

Breathtaking views every corner. A lot of stairs but it's totally worth it. We didn't purchase the one day pass to go inside the city wall, we just purchased the city wall pass and it was €10. Highly recommended place.

places.generalDescription: Fort Lovrijenac, also known as St. Lawrence Fortress, is a 16th-century seaside fortress located in Dubrovnik. It was built to protect the city from Venetian occupiers during the Republic of Ragusa era. The fortress stands on a 37-meter-high rock and is the only freestanding part of Dubrovnik's fortification system. Visitors with tickets for the Walls of Dubrovnik tour can enter Fort Lovrijenac for free.

sources.snippet: Fort Lovrijenac aka, the Red Keep (Game of Thrones) in Dubrovnik Croatia. Pile Harbour, stand in for Blackwater Bay, is easily accessible by stairs. You can rent canoes and small boats in the bay for the day.
sources.shortName: The World's most Romantic City
15 Best Romantic Things to Do in Dubrovnik for Couples
Things to do in Dubrovnik : Museums and attractions

places.name: Tvrđava Lovrjenac / Lovrjenac Fortress

reviews.text: The castle sits on top of a cliff, so be ready to climb a lot of stairs. But it's worth it-the views along the way and especially at the top are absolutely stunning. I recommend going early in the day to avoid the big tour groups and crowds. We got there about 45 minutes after it opened and didn't have to wait in line. There's nothing inside the castle itself, but the breathtaking views of Dubrovnik's old town and the gorgeous coastline make the climb totally worth it.

This is yet another site that's included within the Dubrovnik pass (Foundry museum also) despite it not being mentioned as included on the website. Always best to ask at every place if included.
For sure you get good views from this Fort, but there's nothing else here. If I had to pay for this by itself I probably wouldn't go, but it gives you another perspective on the old town that you don't get from the Walls.

We didn't go into Fort Lovrijenac, but just wandering around the outside was totally worth it. Perched dramatically on a 37-meter-high cliff, the fortress looks like something out of a fantasy novel-no wonder it was used in Game of Thrones!

The surrounding area offers stunning views of the Adriatic Sea, the city walls, and Old Town Dubrovnik. It's a great spot to take photos, catch your breath, and soak in the atmosphere. The climb up is a bit of a workout, but the scenery makes it feel like a reward.

If you're short on time or just want to enjoy the vibe without a ticket, hanging around outside is a solid choice.

places.generalDescription: Nestled near the iconic Pile Gate, Dubravka 1836 Restaurant & Cafe is a delightful spot that combines history with culinary excellence. Established in 1836, this charming eatery offers a relaxed atmosphere where guests can savor traditional Croatian dishes like local fish and Dalmatian rib-eye steak. The restaurant boasts stunning views of the majestic Lovrijenac, Bokar, and Minceta fortresses, making it an ideal location for both dining and sightseeing.

sources.snippet: Sometimes you just have to forget the rush and take a few moments to enjoy delicious bites with the best view of sunning Pile Gate before exploring the Old Town. And what better place to do that than Dubravka restaurant?. Welcome and bon appetit!
sources.shortName: Romantic | Dubrovnik Eats

places.name: Dubravka 1836 Restaurant & Cafe

reviews.text:
We stopped by Dubravka early this morning before heading up to walk the city walls. We were the first ones there and got seated right as they opened at 8 AM.

From the moment we arrived, the service was warm and welcoming. My wife ordered a croissant and was given the option of plain, jam-filled, or chocolate. She chose plain and really enjoyed it.

The coffee was excellent too, rich and smooth, and served in elegant cups that added to the experience.

Beautiful spot by Old Town to enjoy a meal with a view of the sea and the city walls. We all loved our meals, the burrata pizza was the best pizza I've ever had. Attentive service and lovely atmosphere. Would recommend!

Ate here two nights in a row it was that good. Both nights the restaurant was packed and they went out of their way to find us a table on both evenings without a reservation. Very friendly and genuine staff made for a very enjoyable dinner. The food was excellent - very tasty, quick to the table and not over the top expensive, considering its location.

places.generalDescription: The Red History Museum in Dubrovnik offers a candid exploration of Croatia's Communist era, often overlooked by visitors. Divided into three sections, the museum delves into the beginnings of Communism, everyday life in Yugoslavia, and features real-life accounts from Croatians who lived under Socialism. Housed in an industrial factory in Gruz, the museum was founded by a group of young entrepreneurs and takes a neutral approach to its exhibits.

sources.shortName: The 51 best things to do in Dubrovnik

sources.snippet: Dubrovnik Museum scene offers historical Cultural History Museum in the Rector’s Palace, Maritime Museum in Fort St John, Ethnographic Museum Rupe, and Archaeological exhibitions in Revelin Fort, but also features recent additions like The Red History Museum, Homeland War Museum and Love Stories Museum. This is the place to go if you want to find true love stories ‘spoken’ through nostalgic pieces. When it comes to arts and culture, nothing says romance like Dubrovnik Summer Festival.
sources.shortName: Amazing ideas for a romantic getaway in Dubrovnik

places.name: Red History Museum

reviews.text: The Red History Museum in Dubrovnik is such a cool, intimate, and immersive experience. It's a hidden gem that takes you through the city's history with a modern, interactive twist. The exhibits are thoughtfully curated, offering a unique glimpse into both Dubrovnik's past and the broader historical context of the region. The museum is small but packed with rich details, and the way they engage you with hands-on displays makes the visit feel personal. Highly recommend!

This is a wonderful museum-my husband and I absolutely loved it. If you're arriving by ferry or have time before your departure, it's well worth a visit.

Having spent the first years of my life in the former Yugoslavia, walking through the exhibits felt like stepping back in time: the same kind of kitchen my grandmother had, the same old scale, and many other familiar details. It was both nostalgic and deeply moving.

This was such an interesting museum and a very good way to learn about some modern history. The displays were very well done. The music station was our favorite! Loved hearing the Yugoslavian punk rock.

places.generalDescription: Gradska kavana Arsenal Restaurant is situated on the main square near prominent landmarks like Sponza Palace and the Rectors Palace. The cafe features a spacious terrace where locals enjoy their morning coffee, while tourists stop by for drinks and light meals throughout the day. If the terrace is full, visitors can explore the modernly decorated interior or head to the second eastern terrace overlooking the old harbor. Established in 1895, this restaurant offers modernized Mediterranean cuisine in addition to its renovated space.

sources.snippet: Views just make dining all the more luxurious, don’t you think?. If you need a spot where the view is just as perfect as the food, we think this could be just the place for you. Their culinary delights with a stunning sea view as a backdrop will be your unique dining experience in the Old Town.
sources.shortName: Romantic | Dubrovnik Eats

places.name: Gradska kavana Arsenal Restaurant

reviews.text: The receptionist is really friendly and let us sit at the lounge to wait for the table (we didn't make reservation). The food is great and served really fast, and the view from the harbor is also nice. The oyster is super fresh and sweet. The tap beer is also freezing cold enough. The squid is a bit over-salty for me but still good quality and well cooked.

Beautiful Scenery and a Memorable Dining Experience

This restaurant offers a truly unique setting with breathtaking scenery. You can choose to enjoy a stunning view of the sea or face the charming town behind you either way, the atmosphere is peaceful and picturesque, especially during sunset.

The food is very good, with dishes that are flavorful and well-prepared. Portions are on the smaller side, but just enough to leave you satisfied, especially since the quality is excellent. Every bite feels carefully made, and you can tell the kitchen puts real thought into the presentation and taste.

The staff are warm, friendly, and attentive without being overbearing, which really adds to the experience. It's a lovely spot for a quiet, scenic meal whether you're stopping by for lunch or enjoying a romantic evening.

The best place in Dubrovnik for breakfast. The view is stunning. Once seated, the service was very slow. The guys just swan around doing very little, while the women work really hard. That aside, the food was amazing! Super tasty, great portion sizes and speedy in its delivery. We LOVED the breads and spreads that came with it - a really lovely touch. Don't let the bad service ruin what was a great breakfast experience.

places.generalDescription: Nautika is a renowned restaurant located at Pile, near the western entrance to Dubrovnik's Old City. It offers a romantic dining experience with unique terraces that provide stunning views of the Adriatic, Lovrijenac and Bokar fortresses, and the city walls.

sources.snippet: Calling itself ‘Dubrovnik’s finest restaurant’, Nautika is certainly the most prestigious, the kind of place that is the automatic choice whenever the Pope might be in town.
sources.shortName: The 51 best things to do in Dubrovnik

sources.snippet: Nautika lies on the very edge of the sea at Pile, one of the most beautiful locations in the entire city alongside the western part of magnificent city walls. If there is a place where you can taste the most elegant dishes of world-class cuisine, experience a service that will exceed your expectations and enjoy a stunning location beneath a canopy of stars; then it must be here at Nautika restaurant.
sources.shortName: Romantic | Dubrovnik Eats

sources.snippet: There has been a renaissance in Croatian gastronomy over the last decade or so, and things have really taken off. Most Croatian restaurants, including Nautika, draw inspiration from the nation's gastronomic heritage. Nautika cherishes the traditional dishes that we all grew up with, but we also like to incorporate modern trends and influences.
sources.shortName: Nautika Restaurant | Dubrovnik's finest restaurant

sources.snippet: Restaurant Nautika : Nautika Restaurant has been named by CNN as of the world’s best waterfront restaurants. Now Big 7 Travel has named it the 3rd in the world’s most romantic restaurants. It lies on the very edge of the sea at Pile, alongside the western entrance to Dubrovnik’s Old Town.
sources.shortName: Restaurants in Dubrovnik | Most Romantic Places for Dinner

sources.snippet: Intimate dining experiences await at renowned spots like Nautika Restaurant, where the sea views and exquisite cuisine make for an unforgettable evening.
sources.shortName: Romantic Things to Do in Dubrovnik: A Couple's Guide

places.name: Nautika

reviews.text:
An unforgettable fine dining experience! Nautika exceeded all our expectations - from the breathtaking views to the exceptional food and service.

Every dish was beautifully presented, and the quality was simply outstanding. The flavors, textures, and attention to detail were on par with - if not better than - several Michelin-starred restaurants we've tried around the world. And that says a lot, considering we're residents of the UAE and have experienced some top-tier dining.

The staff were not only professional and attentive, but also genuinely warm, friendly, and even a bit entertaining - which added a relaxed charm to the refined setting.

The view overlooking the Adriatic and the city walls made the evening even more magical. Without a doubt, one of the best dining experiences we've had - highly recommended for anyone visiting Dubrovnik.

We dined at Nautika with high expectations, drawn in by its Michelin star reputation, stunning seaside location, and glowing reviews. And in many ways, the experience delivered. The food was truly excellent - each dish beautifully composed and full of flavour. The view alone is worth noting: a cinematic backdrop of a wooden sailboat gliding across the water, alpine swifts darting overhead, and a front-row seat to one of the most picturesque vistas in Dubrovnik.

We were fortunate to enjoy our table for a leisurely three hours, which allowed us to truly settle in and soak up the setting. The staff were warm, gracious, and professional throughout, and we appreciated the thoughtful touches like the complimentary dessert bites and a sweet pomegranate liqueur to end the meal.

That said, a few service details fell short of the fine dining standard one might expect at this price point. Our very kind sommelier seemed somewhat flustered - two of the wine pairings arrived mistimed, one after the dish and one well before. Our water glasses were left empty for long stretches early in the meal, and our napkins weren't refolded when we left the table. Small things, perhaps, but they add up in a place that markets itself on perfection.

In the end, we had a memorable evening, and the food was without fault. But with such a lofty reputation, I was hoping for just a bit more polish. Still, if you're looking for an unforgettable setting and exquisite flavours, Nautika offers both - just know that your expectations may need a touch of calibration.

My jaws literally dropped when they showed us to the table. The views were stunning. Go early so you can see the the transition from day to night and watch the birds soaring effortlessly. The food became incidental in that glorious setting but were overall of a good standard

places.generalDescription: When visiting Dubrovnik, one cannot miss the exhilarating experience offered by Dubrovnik Watersports at Banje Beach. This vibrant hub provides access to luxurious vessels like the Jeanneau Leader 10 and Jeanneau Runabout 755, perfect for exploring the breathtaking Elafiti Islands or the historic shores of Korcula. Whether you're planning a romantic proposal or simply seeking an intimate escape with your partner, these boats offer a stylish way to enjoy the stunning Adriatic scenery.

sources.snippet: Dubrovnik Watersports offers exclusive access to the Jeanneau Leader 10 and Jeanneau Runabout 755, perfect for exploring the stunning destinations around Dubrovnik. Imagine proposing aboard the sleek Jeanneau Leader 10 as you navigate towards the enchanting Elafiti Islands or the historical shores of Korčula. The luxurious Jeanneau Runabout 755 provides an intimate setting for couples, making it an ideal choice for those seeking elegance and privacy amidst the Adriatic’s captivating scenery.
sources.shortName: Romantic Dubrovnik Proposal Ideas for Your Vacation

places.name: Dubrovnik Watersports, Banje beach

reviews.text:
My son (16) and I had the best two hours kayaking around the old town walls, visiting the island and seeing the caves.
We arrived quite early and the lovely owner and his son very kindly let us take the kayaks out when we arrived which was so helpful.
They shared a map and suggested route, which was perfect for the two hours They also gave us a dry bag for my phone!
We wanted to kayak on our own, rather than in a group tour, and we were out so early we didn't see anyone else, just some jellyfish and fish!!
We loved it and would recommend!

I rented a kayak for 2 hours in the morning (just booked the night prior), and it was wonderful! I had most of the sea to myself and kayaked along the walls, then around Lokrum and stopped to swim a few times in inlets and the cave, then went back along the coast to see the more popular cave & cliff jumping spot. The sit on top kayak was comfy and super stable for climbing in and out on the water, and the dry bag provided with the rental was very helpful! I had beautifully calm water and really enjoyed my solo kayak adventure- saw a bunch of small fish, and dolphins while crossing back to the mainland! The staff were really helpful in suggesting a route and getting me out on the water quickly, highly recommend.

We had a fantastic one-hour sunset SUP session. The manager was sweet and kind. The location is perfect, right at Banje Beach and closer to the cave than other rental shops. This made the trip less tiring and much more enjoyable. Highly recommend!

places.generalDescription: Restaurant Ezza in Dubrovnik offers a unique dining experience with its great location and stunning views of the famous Walls of Dubrovnik, ancient port, and Lokrum island. The attentive staff provides excellent service, making it a perfect spot for special occasions like honeymoons or birthdays. Guests rave about the delightful food, including fresh tuna tataki and perfectly cooked T-bone steak. The modern setting adds to the overall fantastic experience, with recommendations on food and wine enhancing the visit.

sources.snippet: Restaurant Dubrovnik : High end and  restaurant for those in the know, this is a gorgeous place to spend an evening with delicious food and ambiance. Situated on the first floor terrace of a sumptuous old town villa, tucked away up a side street. The restaurant has an amazing menu and wines to match definitely one not to miss.
sources.shortName: Restaurants in Dubrovnik | Most Romantic Places for Dinner

sources.snippet: Get ready for your mind to be blown away by their food concept, great location, and one of the most spectacular views in town looking over the famous Walls of Dubrovnik, its ancient port and the romantic island of Lokrum.
sources.shortName: Romantic | Dubrovnik Eats

places.name: Restaurant Ezza, Dubrovnik

reviews.text: Excellent food, service and ambiance! Jovan and his team really took care of our table. We celebrated my Dad's 80th birthday with a cool rocket firecracker on top of the cake and the guys sang him happy birthday. The cocktails and mocktails so creative. Out of this world desserts! Thanks for making it such a memorable dining experience and special trip for the family!

Truly outstanding restaurant!
This was one of the best meals we've ever had. The food was absolutely delicious, and every dish was full of flavor. We were served by Christian, who was incredibly charming and attentive - he made our dining experience even more enjoyable. Highly recommend this place, and we can't wait to come back!

The restaurant is very Beautiful and Fine. Food was excellent and fresh. The Cocktails were also amazing.
The only thing that was Bad, was our waiter, he didnt smile once and was not very Friendly.

places.generalDescription: Nestled in the heart of Dubrovnik's old town, Restaurant 360 is a culinary gem that offers a truly elevated dining experience. Boasting the city's only Michelin star, this restaurant is renowned for its innovative cuisine and breathtaking panoramic views of the sea from its rooftop terrace. The menu features creative tasting options, including vegetarian selections, and an extensive wine list showcasing locally-made wines.

sources.snippet: Restaurant 360 :  Michelin star awarded Restaurant 360 is located in the old town with impressive views of the port. The Terrace stretches over the medieval walls. It has an amazing array of dishes which changes constantly.
sources.shortName: Restaurants in Dubrovnik | Most Romantic Places for Dinner

places.name: Restaurant 360

reviews.text: We had the most amazing evening looking over the harbour enjoying our dining experience. The staff were incredible from the door to the table. Everyone knew their stuff. Marijo has put together several works of art. Each course was presented spectacularly. Our sommelier paired some interesting wines for our dishes. The waiting staff were fun, professional and attentive. Thank you all for a wonderful evening with my wife and mother in law.

Deserving of all its accolades.

We were fortunate to get a stand-by reservation for two in late June.  To 360's credit, when we showed up with our little boy in tow, the hostess did not bat an eye and took us to a table for three.

Our son was provided his own Kid's menu and selected chicken and fries.

We were not hungry enough to justify the tasting menu and chose the “S” and “M” selections.  “S” meant that I was able to choose a dessert, while my wife chose two starters with the “M” menu.

Everything we ate was fantastic!  And the service was impeccable.  The staff truly seemed to enjoy working at the restaurant.

This was our first stop for dinner on our honeymoon and it was exceptional. The atmosphere of the restaurant is unlike any other dining experience you will have. The service staff was top notch. Even though we did not do the tasting menu - our entire meal was set up in the style of one! Their menu has some of the freshest fish we have ever had - very clear as to why this place has 1 Michelin star. Thank you for one of the best dining experiences!

places.generalDescription: Park Orsula is a hidden gem in Dubrovnik, offering breathtaking panoramic views of the old city, Croatian coastline, and the Adriatic Sea. Once an ancient trade route site, it has been restored and opened to the public since 2012. The park's unique aura creates a magical and romantic atmosphere, making it perfect for early morning or evening visits to witness stunning sunsets and sunrises.

sources.snippet: While city walls, fortresses, medieval bridges, cobble streets with renaissance-baroque or beaches with Old Town in the background make obvious locations, why not consider some lesser-known spots like summer residences of Rijeka Dubrovačka, open-air park Orsula, recently renovated Park Gradac, or padlocks of love at Boninovo?. In either case, the moment and emotions captured will last a lifetime. Dubrovnik locks of love Dubrovnik, like Rome’s Ponte Milvio and Paris’s Pont de l’Archaveche and Pont des Arts, has its own special place for the celebration of love.
sources.shortName: Amazing ideas for a romantic getaway in Dubrovnik

sources.siteName: Love and Ventures - Europe and Croatia Elopement Photographer
sources.shortName: Dubrovnik for couples: 7 romantic ideas

places.name: Park Orsula

reviews.text: Beautiful spot to take pictures!
One of the best spots for sunset watching! You wont regret going here. On Instagram check out their account for events around the area! @parkorsula

This place is fine for concerts and events, but it needs to be renovated. It is extremely uncomfortable to stand there because all of the little rocks around. Especially for 2 hours of standing and sitting on stairs. The view is magical and wonderful from up there, but still place is not worth the hype.

places.generalDescription: The restaurant Art Renaissance is hidden away from the passengers on Stradun, but is close enough to all major attractions. The food here is exceptional with great service and a friendly atmosphere.

sources.snippet: Are you ready to “dolce far niente” in the very heart of the city?. Art Renaissance is a charming restaurant located right next to the main street, hidden away from the travelers on Stradun. Be the one who discovers it and keeps it for yourself.
sources.shortName: Romantic | Dubrovnik Eats

places.name: Art Restaurant Renaissance

reviews.text: This restaurant was life changing. My friends and I recently stumbled across it and we were amazed by the atmosphere and how it's tucked away from the busy streets. The food was absolutely amazing everyone loved every dish. The prices were very good considering we're university students on a budget. Especially when other restaurants in Dubrovnik have similar prices and are not nearly as good, this restaurant has great value for your money. The atmosphere of this restaurant was unreal. It's so beautiful and there was an amazing musician singing classic songs. Some of us started to get emotional. Overall every aspect was amazing and we strongly recommend this restaurant to anyone visiting Dubrovnik.

We stumbled upon this lovely restaurant whilst walking through Dubrovnik old town, which turned out to be the same restaurant we had visited on our last trip to Dubrovnik 7 years ago! The live music and fairy lights were inviting and added to a wonderfully relaxed dining atmosphere. The food was spectacular (even better than we remember) with the veal liver an absolute must try! The service was impeccable; attentive and friendly. We couldn't have had a better first night in Dubrovnik. We will definitely be back ❤️

Absolutely one of the best spots in Dubrovnik! The evening setting is stunning and so romantic. The prawn pasta and carbonara were incredible, and the food was so good we couldn't resist ordering the black risotto too - hands down one of the best dishes we've had during our trip. An unforgettable experience!

places.generalDescription: Hilton Imperial Dubrovnik is a luxurious accommodation housed in a historic 1890s building, conveniently situated near the UNESCO World Heritage Site of Dubrovnik's Old Town. The hotel offers an array of amenities including a restaurant, indoor pool, and wellness center with saunas, hammam, fitness facilities, and massage services. The guest rooms exude late 19th-century charm while incorporating modern technology for a comfortable stay.

sources.snippet: Just outside the historic city walls by the Pile Gate, the Hilton Imperial Dubrovnik is the city's grande dame property. It dates back to the 19th century and offers direct access to the Old Town. While the public spaces of the hotel feature much of the original late 1800s architectural stylings, like stone columns and an impressive staircase, the 149 rooms and suites have a more contemporary vibe and are very spacious and airy.
sources.shortName: 15 Top-Rated Places to Stay in Dubrovnik

places.name: Hilton Imperial Dubrovnik

reviews.text: We had an exceptional stay at the Hilton in Dubrovnik. From the moment we arrived, the staff was warm, professional, and attentive to every detail. The rooms were spotless, beautifully designed, and offered stunning views. The location is perfect-just a short walk from the Old Town. The breakfast was delicious with a great variety, and all hotel amenities were top-notch. We truly couldn't have asked for a better experience. Highly recommended!

A beautiful hotel in the best location.  Steps away from old town Dubrovnik.

It is perfect if you want to be in the middle of it all and then be able to return to a quiet hotel.
Staff was attentive, rooms clean and spacious.

Our favorite was the breakfast, offering a buffet and some items to be ordered of card. The nice man working there made the best Cafe latte I had during our whole vacation.

The executive lounge was nice too, most memorable the fantastic desserts offered.

An elegant, extremely well managed hotel.  Its central location was perfect. Gracious rooms and common areas.  Live music Thursday evenings on the terrace were wonderful.  Breakfasts and dining in the restaurant were most agreeable! Hospitality service and attention to details left nothing to be desired!  I applaud this establishment !

places.generalDescription: When you find yourself wandering the picturesque streets of Dubrovnik, make sure to stop by Gianni's artisanal ice cream and cake shop. This delightful little gem, tucked away behind the Old Port in the Old Town, is a testament to quality over quantity. Formerly a pastry chef at the renowned Restaurant 360, Gianni crafts some of the finest gelato in town using natural ingredients that shine through in every scoop.

sources.snippet: Owned by a true resident of the Old Town, Đani, a man who’s been practicing his craft with some of the best pastry chefs from the famous 360 Restaurant, a few years ago Old Town got its first artisanal dessert and ice cream shop within the walls.
sources.shortName: Romantic | Dubrovnik Eats

places.name: Gianni

reviews.text:
A busy ice scream store in a city with many ice cream shops.
This seems a cut above with a decent selection of interesting and delicious ice cream and Sorbets. There are a few tables which are a great place to sit but it can get very busy with long queues depending on the occasional tour group.
It's tucked away but not far from the square or harbour.
The coffee is also very good. The staff are friendly and helpful.
We had the Pistacchio, goat cheese and blackcurrant and the honey and lavender. All delicious. Recommended

Gianni is famous for Ice Cream mostly, but I tried “Karob Cake”. A traditional Croatian Cake that I have never encountered before! It tastes like strong intense chocolate, but it has no Chocolate at all! A very interesting excellent texture.

The cappuccino was excellent too!

Mostly people order for take out, yet they have a nice wooden outside seating area.

Surprisingly, I visited them once again to try their ice cream. Honestly, I didn't like it. This would be my opinion! The place is almost full all the time, and people seem to enjoy it.

Highly recommended for cakes, and not for ice cream!

The perfect stop to rest and recharge after walking the walks.
So glad we found this little cafe and bagged a seat under the awning just before the rain came!
So many delightful pastries to choose from, so we had a selection of Paris–Brest, torte and chocolate and nut brownie, as well as a refreshing gelato.
Would definitely recommend a visit while you're visiting the old city. Not least to meet the resident cat who joined us for a well deserved rest!

places.address: Ul. kneza Damjana Jude bb, 20000, Dubrovnik, Croatia

places.generalDescription: Fort Bokar, a massive fortress built in the 15th century, stands proudly by the ocean with its distinctive cylindrical architecture. This historic site has been featured in popular culture, notably in Game of Thrones. It is part of Dubrovnik's formidable defensive system and was frequently showcased in the series as characters walked along the city walls.

sources.snippet: This is where Game of Thrones shoots scenes for Blackwater Bay. Totally accessible and beautiful. The small beach to the left is covered by kayaks during the day.
sources.shortName: The World's most Romantic City

places.name: Fort Bokar

reviews.text: You can't actually enter this part only the very top ramparts that are part of the walk way. Great views of dubrovnik old town and surrounding areas. Best buy the dubrovnik pass as tickets are then included for free as well as other places.

Visited this fortress early April. Included in the Dubrovnik pass. Would highly recommend anyone to purchase the 3 days pass (€50) as weather was unpredictable and it included many attractions in one pass so one could explore Dubrovnik leisurely. This fortress was spectacular when we visited on the second day in Dubrovnik on a sunny day (first day was cloudy so we walked around Stradum without climbing the old city walls). This is not to be missed!

How Amazing!
Dubrovnik Is A Historical Landmark Of Beauty.
WOW WOW WOW.
So Pretty Moonlight And Fort Compliment Each Other.
Pretty In Day And Night Anytime.
Never Regret Coming Here.
Good Food Good Sight And Good Weather In September.

places.generalDescription: Stradun is a lively limestone-paved pedestrian street located in the historic center of Dubrovnik. This car-free area within medieval walls is bustling with activity, offering a plethora of narrow alleys filled with charming restaurants and cafes. Visitors can opt for vacation rentals in the heart of the ancient town, providing an immersive experience unlike that of a typical hotel stay. In the morning, one can soak up the vibrant atmosphere on Stradun, taking in sights such as St.

sources.snippet: You’ll see that a walk through Dubrovnik is something special, of course, we mean the Old Town and a walk along Stradun. Stradun or Placa Street in Dubrovnik is the main street in the old city center. It is the most famous street in Dubrovnik in general, very busy and always nicely filled.
sources.siteName: Explore Dubrovnik | Private Boat Tours Dubrovnik | Rent a Boat Dubrovnik
sources.shortName: 5 Romantic Things to do in Dubrovnik

sources.snippet: Wandering around the main street of Stradun or the winding medieval side streets is the perfect way to spend a romantic evening in Dubrovnik.
sources.shortName: 15 Best Romantic Things to Do in Dubrovnik for Couples
The five most romantic spots in Dubrovnik for Valentine’s Day

places.name: Stradun

reviews.text: This is the main street of Dubrovnik old town. Walking down thru this street feels like going back in time. This is something notable in Dubrovnik and you can not miss this street. I went there during the night as well as in the day and it looked equally beautiful at all times. Highly recommended.

The heart of the old town!
I recommend not shopping too much- we bought shirts, hats, sunglasses etc… then found other stores in out of town shopping malls with much cheaper prices.
You can't best the atmosphere of this street though!
This is a main street in the old town and is busy with shops and restaurants. It is especially lovely in the evenings, it is alive with activity

places.generalDescription: Puzzle Punks - Dubrovnik Escape Room offers two elaborately themed rooms suitable for families and groups of 2 to 5 players. Participants have a 60-minute time limit to uncover clues, solve puzzles, and escape the room. One room involves saving a kingdom while the other focuses on finding hidden treasure and learning about Dubrovnik's history. Prices range from 24 to 30 per person depending on group size and season.

sources.snippet: Escape rooms are the perfect date night activity for the adventurous, where you and your partner use your wits to escape from an immersive, entertaining scenario. There’s nothing quite like the feeling of working together to solve a puzzle or complete an escape room—it’s pure magic and makes for an unforgettable date experience.
sources.siteName: Puzzle Punks - Escape Boredom! Fun is our business
sources.shortName: Dubrovnik for couples: discover spectacular romatic places

sources.snippet: Our friends run it and one day we were early in Dubrovnik and choose to pay them a visit. Never tried it before and we didn’t know what to expect. But we were never hyped about it.
sources.siteName: Love and Ventures - Europe and Croatia Elopement Photographer
sources.shortName: Dubrovnik for couples: 7 romantic ideas

places.name: Puzzle Punks - Dubrovnik Escape Room

reviews.text:
We had an incredible time with the “Save The King's Landing” experience!

The challenges were engaging, and the immersive space was creatively designed. Even if you're not a Game of Thrones fan, you'll still have a blast. It's perfect for groups of 3-5 people.

Highly recommend giving it a try!

Fantastic experience and highly recommended. The owner of the escape room is super open-minded and friendly. You immediately feel at ease in her presence. The two rooms are creatively furnished, air-conditioned (perfect in summer) and we really enjoyed solving the puzzles. Don't be put off by the musty shopping center or entrance area. It's really worth it to switch off for an hour and feel like a child again. Tip: The rooms are located in the basement of the shopping center and were a little difficult to find. It would help a lot if there were better signs or photos on the website with a description of the location.

Great escape room! We did Save King's Landing and had a great time. We are big Game of Thrones fans (which only helped a little) and the room was thick with references to the book/show. There were 2 of us (decently experienced (~40 rooms each)) and we used 2 hints (of unlimited) to escape with 8 minutes left. We were told the other room had a focus on the history of Dubrovnik, but we didn't have time to do it.

The company is located on the bottom floor next to the Tommy supermarket, which is downstairs from most of the cafes.

places.address: Inside DOC Shopping Center, Ul. kralja Tomislava 7, 20000, Dubrovnik, Croatia

places.generalDescription: This charming boutique sells unique home decor and design items made by Croatian designers and artisans. It is located just outside Ploce Gate, and its selection of trendy products includes contemporary ties, handmade leather items, Calypso perfume, T-shirts and mugs with Dalmatian designs. The store also stocks olive oil from Perdisacca, smoked sea salt from Nin, beautiful wooden bowls made from mocvara hrast (ancient oak), and Croatian cookery books.

sources.snippet: A showroom-sized shop devoted to Croatian-made artisan and designer products, Life According to Kawa is just what you need after being bored to desperation by the mugs, fridge magnets and plastic dragons of the regular gift shops.
sources.shortName: The 51 best things to do in Dubrovnik

places.name: Life According to KAWA

reviews.text: Life According to KAWA is more of a concept store than a traditional café, but it's definitely worth a stop-especially for the coffee. They serve excellent specialty coffee, some of the best I've had in the area. The space is packed with all kinds of items, from souvenirs to local drinks, so it feels more like a trendy shop that also happens to make great coffee. Prices are a bit on the higher side, but the atmosphere is lively, touristy, and enjoyable. If you're in Old Town and looking for a quality caffeine fix, this place is worth a visit.

Tucked just outside the old town gate, Kawa is the perfect spot to ease into the day. Serving Cogito coffee-fair trade and roasted in Zagreb-the brew is strong, smooth, and satisfying. Whether you grab a seat inside among curated souvenirs or bask in the morning air on the terrace, there's an easygoing charm to this place. Chill music drifts through the space, and the owner from Vancouver adds to the warm vibe, always greeting you with a smile. It's a great place to sip slowly and watch the rhythm of the old town come alive.

Coffee was actually better in the old town cogito but people here were so nice. I always see people chatting to the stuffs and they enjoyed a lot. I myself spoke to a lady she explained about their products and current situation of Croatia. I visited there multiple times and everyone was nice.

Also if you are looking for hip drink it has a lot. Some special Soda, craft beers etc. I also liked they try to support local productions and artists.

places.generalDescription: Plaža Sveti Jakov is a secluded beach located in a picturesque cove, accessible via stairs leading down to the sandy shore. Visitors can enjoy the serene atmosphere and stunning views of the Old Town from this hidden gem. The beach offers a cafe and bar for refreshments, adding to the overall experience. Additionally, nearby attractions such as Betina Cave Beach and Hotel Belvedere provide alternative options for exploration and discovery.

sources.shortName: 15 Best Romantic Things to Do in Dubrovnik for Couples

places.name: Plaža Sveti Jakov

reviews.text: An absolute hidden gem next to some of Dubrovnik's bigger beaches but this was by far, the best! It's quite steep to get to with a 5 minute walk down various stairs from the top of old town but well worth it. Lovely azure water, sunbeds that you can rent for €25 each (all come with umbrellas), a bar and restaurant and good music beach played throughout. It looks crowded but plenty of space for everyone. Was so glad that TikTok helped us come across this!

Chose to spend a guilt free beach day here on our last day in Croatia. Did not disappoint! Got to the beach for 10 30 and easily got a spot in the second row. Sunbeds were nice and comfy and 25 euros each for the day (15 extra for an umbrella) which didn't feel too bad. After spending lots of days swimming in more quiet spots straight off the rocks (as we don't like loud busy beaches), this delivered a nice change in scene. The beach was busy by midday but not so much that it ruined the relaxed atmosphere, and the size of it feels very intimate, with the palm fronded beach bar giving it an almost tropical feel. The beach bar does great burgers and various other bar snacks such as fried fish and calamari and salads, although the salads looked a little basic. There is also one proper beach restaurant on the other side of the beach. The water was very calm too. If you're looking for a proper beach day with all the works but without the obnoxiously loud music and crowds, this is the perfect spot!

Lovely hidden beach with lounge rentals and umbrellas (65 euro for 2 w umbrella) Bar, cafe, and restroom available. Less crowded than by Dubrovnik wall but many steps down and pebble beach, bring water shoes. Lovely day!🏖️

places.generalDescription: Coral Beach Club Dubrovnik, located on the Lapad Peninsula, offers a luxurious and relaxing setting to enjoy stunning sunsets and refreshing cocktails. With panoramic views of the Adriatic Sea, this upscale venue provides a sophisticated beach club atmosphere. It is highly regarded for its crystal-clear sea, Ibiza music, Dalmatian lifestyle, and Mediterranean delicacies. The beach club stands out with its unique design and first-rate amenities, including an open-air restaurant shaped like a shell.

sources.shortName: 15 Best Romantic Things to Do in Dubrovnik for Couples

places.name: Coral Beach Club Dubrovnik

reviews.text:
What an amazing location! Idyllic, peaceful, beautiful. Because if that, it is a short walk from where you would be dropped off.

The beach is small rocks, not sand, so be prepared with footwear.

Food wise left a lot to desired for the price. We were recommended to get the pizza but they aren't serving it this month (May). The rest of the food options were overpriced and average. The same goes for drinks, although a bottle of wine to split could be justifiable.

Me and my girlfriend had an amazing day here. We wanted a chill day away from the hustle and bustle of Dubrovnik, and coral beach club was just the ticket. The chill house music vibes from the DJ's were good and we had the views to match. All the food and drinks we had were top notch and really good quality. Big shout out to our server, Egor. He made our day perfect and his service to us was incredible. Highly recommend this place!

We had the absolute best experience at this beach club! The service we received was unmatched anywhere else during our entire tour of Europe. Our server went above and beyond in every way-he was incredibly attentive, always checking in at just the right time, and made us feel completely taken care of. On top of that, he was so friendly and easy to talk to, which made the whole experience even more enjoyable. Truly the best service we've had on our trip, and we couldn't be happier. Highly recommend! ASK FOR MARIN!!!

places.address: Ul. Ivana pl. Zajca 30, 20000, Dubrovnik, Croatia

places.generalDescription: Hotel Bellevue Dubrovnik is a modern and luxurious seaside hotel located in the Lapad area of Dubrovnik. It is part of the renowned Adriatic Luxury Hotels group and offers refined rooms and suites with stunning views of the Adriatic Sea. The hotel features seafood dining, a spa, a private beach, and an outdoor pool for guests to enjoy.

sources.snippet: The luxe Hotel Bellevue Dubrovnik is in a beautiful location built into a cliff and fronting a small pebble and sand beach in a sheltered bay, about a 15-minute walk from the entrance to Old Town. It offers 91 rooms and suites, many with ocean views and balconies in a modern building and is a popular choice for couples. Rooms feature wood furnishings and floors and earth-toned linens on comfy beds.
sources.shortName: 15 Top-Rated Places to Stay in Dubrovnik

places.name: Hotel Bellevue Dubrovnik

reviews.text: What a fabulous hotel! Location was great (on a beach and about a 15 minute walk from the old town). The decor is very serene and calm. Staff were all so friendly and professional, the room (we stayed in 209) was fairly small but comfortable and had: a great bed, lovely bathroom, ample closet space, a Nespresso machine, a balcony with beautiful views. There's a modest gym and indoor pool. The terrace for cocktails was lovely and breakfast was really very good too. The beach was unexpectedly closed - which was a shame - when we visited. Overall a wonderful hotel that I'd love to return to.

Incredible room. The room was clean and completely updated, and the view from our balcony and breakfast was absolutely breathtaking. I could stare out at the view for hours. The hotel overlooks a beautiful secluded beach inlet, something you only see on tv or in a magazine. We stayed in 3 hotels during our honeymoon (all around the same price point) in Croatia and this was by far the best one. Everything we had at breakfast was delicious, and there were so many options. There must have been 4 or 5 types of honey, and a hot food menu where you could order something made fresh. Even the eggs were amazing, the best scrambled eggs I've ever had. There was no outdoor pool but we didn't mind, because we were busy walking around the old city and doing excursions all day, and the hotel has access to the sea below. The service was also great, they unexpectedly upgraded our room since we were on our honeymoon. The entire stay was incredible, I would stay there again in a heartbeat.

Amazing views from bar and deck. Small public beach, easily accessible with lounge chairs and umbrellas. Walkable to piles gate (1km/10 min). We got a nice welcome amenity for our anniversary and an oversized room (601) which we appreciated very much. Views were limited and there was quite some road traffic if we left the bathroom door open as on a busy road. Breakfast was abundant, service extraordinary, the sauna/ indoor pool/ wellness center greatly appreciated.

places.generalDescription: The Love Stories Museum in Dubrovnik is a heartwarming celebration of romance, featuring love stories from local folklore, mythology, and personal tales told through donated objects. It also showcases famous romances from movies and TV series filmed in Dubrovnik, including Game of Thrones. Unlike the Museum of Broken Relationships in Zagreb, this museum focuses on uplifting love stories rather than heartbreak.

sources.snippet: Dubrovnik Museum scene offers historical Cultural History Museum in the Rector’s Palace, Maritime Museum in Fort St John, Ethnographic Museum Rupe, and Archaeological exhibitions in Revelin Fort, but also features recent additions like The Red History Museum, Homeland War Museum and Love Stories Museum. This is the place to go if you want to find true love stories ‘spoken’ through nostalgic pieces. When it comes to arts and culture, nothing says romance like Dubrovnik Summer Festival.
sources.shortName: Amazing ideas for a romantic getaway in Dubrovnik

sources.snippet: The Love Stories Museum celebrates love by showcasing a variety of sentimental and unique things. Objects are donated to the museum, and each tells a real-life love story of someone from around the world.
sources.shortName: 15 Best Romantic Things to Do in Dubrovnik for Couples

sources.snippet: It’s similar to the famous Museum of Broken Relationships in Zagreb, except this museum focuses on stories of ever-lasting love.
sources.shortName: 13 Romantic Things to Do in Dubrovnik
Romantic things to do in Dubrovnik

places.name: Love Stories Museum

reviews.text: We visited the museum on our way out of Old Town and were glad we did.  What a cute museum dedicated to love!  The host was very kind and explained about the experience and offered free candy.  The museum had photos and stories about famous people thoughout croatian history, movie/music history, and Game of Thrones (as some of that show was shot in Dubrovnik.) I loved the 3rd floor with postits about love.  You get a discount with the Dubrovnik pass.  It's down a bit of a back alley, but worth it!

This museum is a time machine and you will be traveling back to the greatest times of your life.

The Love Story Museum in Dubrovnik is an absolutely enchanting and soul-stirring experience. From the moment you step inside, you're enveloped in warmth and tenderness, and each exhibit tells a unique, beautiful story of love that has endured through time, obstacles, and distance.
This museum isn't just a collection of objects; it's a true sanctuary for romantics and all who believe in the power of genuine emotion. I was particularly touched by the stories from local history, which intimately and personally depicted how love blossomed even in past centuries. The interactive parts of the museum are brilliant, allowing you to truly connect with the narratives, making the experience even more personal and unforgettable.

A special and unique museum. It may be small but it packs in a range of exhibits, love tokens, photographs, personal stories from film stars, writers and people like me. You can't help but feel the warmth that the museum creators intended. At the end of our visit my partner sang some classic love songs to the museum owner. It was a wonderful moment in our holiday. Love really does make the world go round!

places.generalDescription: Porporela is a 19th-century pier located on the eastern side of Dubrovnik's Old Town, just outside the fortified walls. It's a popular spot for leisurely walks, offering stunning sea views and access to nearby shops and eateries. The pier is particularly favored for watching the sunrise, as its east-facing position provides an ideal vantage point.

sources.snippet: Porporela – the breakwater that protects the Old City from high seas is also a quiet spot to be with your loved one.
sources.shortName: The five most romantic spots in Dubrovnik for Valentine’s Day

places.name: Porporela

reviews.text: Porporela is a Dubrovnik old town landmark and 19th century pier. It's very popular among tourists for taking walks,  getting sea views, swimming,  shopping and  eating.  It looks like a small strip from the top and has a very unique look. Very unique place in Dubrovnik old town.

Beautiful at dusk when the sun is setting and the lights brighten up the pier.  Perfect for a. After dinner stroll, or to sit at one of the many benches along the walkway.

The views of the mountains and the old town from the pier are wonderful.

We stumbled across this while walking around the outside walls.  Lovely spot to soak up the rays, go for a swim n dive off the rocks n walls.  Beautiful vista of the corner of the old city wall, groups of kayakers go past every hour or so as well as small and big boats.  Locals n tourists alike taking in the beautiful weather and vista.

places.generalDescription: Explore Dubrovnik offers private boat tours and yacht tours in the stunning city of Dubrovnik, located on the Adriatic coast in southern Croatia. The city's narrow streets and historic monuments are best explored through small group tours, providing an immersive experience of its rich history and vibrant culture. Visitors can't miss iconic attractions like the City Walls and Srd Hill, offering breathtaking panoramic views of the Old Town surrounded by City Walls.

sources.snippet: Exclusive boat rental in Dubrovnik is saying yes to relaxation and serenity. whilst saying no to the commotion, noise, and packed spaces. Although being in the midst of the Old Town’s ambiance is definitely something to experience, drifting offshore can be a rather exhilarating experience.
sources.siteName: Explore Dubrovnik | Private Boat Tours Dubrovnik | Rent a Boat Dubrovnik
sources.shortName: 5 Romantic Things to do in Dubrovnik

places.name: Explore Dubrovnik

reviews.text: Ivan was an amazing captain!!  You can tell he's been doing this a while!  He is VERY SKILLED!  We had such a great time with him!  He brought us to all of the cool places!!  I would highly recommend this trip and requesting Ivan!!!  I just can't get over how blue the water is in Croatia!!

I had the best time on the boat with my friends, Ivan had all the supplies we needed including snorkels, floats and beers! We went to really beautiful swimming spots and caves, and also stopped off for a short break in a very cute town down the coastline. 10/10 recommend

We took a private boat tour of the Elaphiti Islands with Toni as our captain. It was spectacular. Toni was very competent and knew where to take us to snorkel and swim. He made dinner reservations for us on one of the islands. It was the best fish meal we consumed on the trip. He was able to tell us some of the history about the islands as well. We had a wonderful afternoon and would definitely book again.

places.generalDescription: Villa Dubrovnik d.d. is an elegant contemporary hotel nestled along the coastline, offering stunning sea views and a convenient location near the Old Town. The hotel features stylish quarters with private balconies, some equipped with jacuzzis, and mid-century modern decor. Guests can enjoy two restaurants, a pool and spa, as well as a private beach on the waterfront. The property also provides amenities for families such as children's menus and babysitting services.

sources.snippet: Sitting on the rocky coastline overlooking the Adriatic Sea, the Villa Dubrovnik is a popular romantic luxury hotel pick for couples and offers a free shuttle into the Old Town. The design-forward hotel is done up in neutral colors with a nautical theme in the 56 rooms and suites, which come with sea or city views. Away from the rooms, expect amenities like a large, indoor swimming pool, with awesome sea views from the room's floor-to-ceiling windows, and a spa with a sauna, steam room, and gym.
sources.shortName: 15 Top-Rated Places to Stay in Dubrovnik

places.name: Villa Dubrovnik d.d.

reviews.text:
This place has beautiful breath taking views both inside and out! It's perched on a cliff over looking the Adriatic Sea. They offer a free three course lunch and free shuttle service. Their roof top wine bar is sublime especially at sunset when the birds (swallows?) swirl in the sky. I enjoyed the sauna, and the nightly chocolate treat near the bed. Nice touch.
This place would be exceptional if you are really into TV as it sits right at the foot of the bed! For me though, I found it unusual and certainly unnecessary, especially considering your view out the balcony. The balcony was breath taking but did not have a handle to get back into the room,.... I felt bad smearing the spotless window each time I needed to get back into my room. On our departure, I found out that they are going to be doing some remodeling,.... My hope is that they ditch the TV altogether, or at least mount it to a wall, install bidets on the toilet, and they provide handles on the balcony.

We just checked out of a three night stay at the newly renovated Villa Dubrovnik. Everything was exceptional!  The food was great and the views all around the hotel were breathtaking.  The hotel was immaculate and the service was professional and friendly.  They went out of their way to accommodate any requests. Two of our bags were lost by Delta and the reception at the hotel called the airport to coordinate transfer of our bags to the hotel when they were found. Highly recommend this hotel!

Just spent 4 nights here and it was one of the most amazing travel experiences that we have ever had. The property is amazing as it's situated on a cliff with breathtaking views and only a short 10-15 min walk to the old town. We could have stayed for another 4 nights as we didn't get a chance to discover all of the hidden gems of the area.
Came down with a bit of food poisoning from a restaurant in the old town (not at the hotel) and the staff was nothing but sensational. They were very concerned about my welfare and even brought electrolytes and medicine to help with the illness. Simply amazing people, amazing property. We will be back next year.

places.generalDescription: Lokrum is an essential stop for anyone exploring Dubrovnik. This small island, just a short boat ride away from the city's old harbor, offers a blend of natural beauty and cultural heritage. Visitors can wander through pine woods, explore a botanical garden with exotic plants, stroll along shaded paths, and enjoy stunning views of Dubrovnik and the open sea. The island also features an old Benedictine monastery that now houses a restaurant, adding to its historical charm.

sources.snippet: An uninhabited isle on Dubrovnik's doorstep, Lokrum is an unspoilt isle lush with pines, palms and cypress trees. Its verdant coastline beckons from the hotel windows of Ploče. Dotted with diverse ruins and remnants - medieval, ecclesiastical, Napoleonic, Habsburg - it has long been given over to nature.
sources.shortName: The 51 best things to do in Dubrovnik

sources.snippet: There’s nothing quite like looking out over the picturesque terracotta rooftops, the much island of Lokrum and the vast Adriatic sea while holding your loved one close. As the sun sets, watch the sky burst into vibrant reds, oranges, pinks and purples before the sun takes its final dip below the shimmering waters. Watching the sunset from the top of Mount Srđ is one of the most magical things to do for couples in Dubrovnik.
sources.shortName: Magical things to do for couples in Dubrovnik

sources.snippet: If you prefer a proposal surrounded by natural beauty and lush landscapes, consider the islands of Hvar and Lokrum. Hvar is renowned for its vibrant lavender fields, rugged scenery, and the historic Spanish fortress, which offers breathtaking views of the town and sea. The Pakleni Islands, just off the coast of Hvar, are another heavenly choice, known for their secluded beaches and coves.
sources.shortName: Romantic Dubrovnik Proposal Ideas for Your Vacation

sources.snippet: There are plenty of romantic things to do in Dubrovnik, whether you want to get dressed up for a fancy dinner, watch the sun go down from the top of Mount Srd or take to the waters and kayak across to the quieter Lokrum Island. There’s even a museum dedicated to love, so you really couldn’t ask for a more romantic spot than this beautiful Croatian city!
sources.shortName: Romantic things to do in Dubrovnik

sources.snippet: You don’t need anyone, no need for the officiant and you can combine the city photo session with the ceremony on Lokrum Island or Park Orsula in the sunset which is further on our list, for example. If you ask us, it is a great idea to elope in Dubrovnik.
sources.siteName: Love and Ventures - Europe and Croatia Elopement Photographer
sources.shortName: Dubrovnik for couples: 7 romantic ideas

sources.snippet: You can easily organize your own day trip to Lokrum Island by catching the ferry from Dubrovnik’s Old Town Pier. This peaceful nature reserve is just a short 10 minute boat ride away and provides a dreamy escape from the city’s crowded streets.
sources.shortName: 13 Romantic Things to Do in Dubrovnik

sources.snippet: A 10 minute ferry ride to the most wonderful island near Dubrovnik will delight you and your significant other. Not only can you take a walk in the nature and meet friendly bunnies and peacocks, you can make a picnic anywhere on the island.
sources.siteName: Puzzle Punks - Escape Boredom! Fun is our business
sources.shortName: Dubrovnik for couples: discover spectacular romatic places

sources.snippet: Kayaking around the old town of Dubrovnik or even to Lokrum Island is one of the most popular things to do in the city. This adventurous and fun activity is perfect for couples that are active or love the outdoors.
sources.shortName: 15 Best Romantic Things to Do in Dubrovnik for Couples

sources.snippet: Dubrovnik Old Town and Lokrum Island (in the background) at Sunset. You can also see a bit of the Old Town Harbor to the left where the Dubrovnik Aquarium is. From there you can take a ferry over to Lokrum Island.
sources.shortName: The World's most Romantic City

sources.snippet: The islet of Lokrum is only a 10-minute boat ride away from Dubrovnik. The next “beach” on our list is right there. We put the beach under the supposed signs because it is actually a lake!.
sources.siteName: Explore Dubrovnik | Private Boat Tours Dubrovnik | Rent a Boat Dubrovnik
sources.shortName: 5 Romantic Things to do in Dubrovnik

sources.snippet: For those seeking a bit of adventure, a boat tour to Lokrum Island or a swim at Betina Cave brings a sense of escape.
sources.shortName: Romantic Things to Do in Dubrovnik: A Couple's Guide

places.name: Lokrum

reviews.text: Lokrum or lokrum island is a natural reserve located right off the coast of Dubrovnik. It has a monastery, a beautiful forest and a botanical garden. There are a couple of restaurants too on the island. There are a lot of peacocks roaming almost everywhere on the island. The monastery has a couple of beautiful filming locations for the popular GoT series. The island is serviced by a ferry which leaves Dubrovnik harbour every 30 mins.

It is an island some 15 minutes away (1km)from dubrovnik. You can book tickets online (lokrum webshop)or just walk up to the old town pier(turning left from the supposedly beat gelato shop.
Ticket kiosk is on the right after the restaurant seating. The boat is brown and white called the zrinski.
Carry some sandwiches and beer from the store before the entrance if you want or there are plenty of nice restaurants on the island.
It is a beautiful island with lots of trees and shade. Star attraction is the stunningly beautiful peacocks walking around and are comfortable in your presence.Dont feed them and dont touch them please.  You can check out the monastery(not functional) but you have a nice looking restaurant here and the iron throne where you can sit on and take pictures . A bit of a steep climb on a stony broken path to the right to the ruins of the small fort and nice views. Do check out the corner bench next to the exit with the best view. Then back down to the monastery( you can use the lavatory here if you want) towards the small water body where you can swim if you want. You can play volleyball and football as it has option for both and of course play zone for little kids.
Plenty of areas on this island where you can go down the steps to the water.
Took us some 4hrs back to the pier in dubrovnik.
You can take maybe 5-6hrs if you want to picnic sitting on the benches near the monastery or eat at the restaurants.
While sitting on the benches peacocks do come looking for food but keep it high on the benches. Dont feed them.They just hover around and dont say anything.
Overall keep this for the last day as a filler.

Great place to visit.
beautiful island with great history.
amazing places to swim.
easy to spend a day there .
and I got to sit on the Iron throne (from game of thrones)
great views of Dubrovnik.
cafes and nice places to sit and enjoy a drink.

places.generalDescription: Fish Restaurant Proto is a popular dining spot in Dubrovnik, known for its delectable seafood dishes and inviting atmosphere. The restaurant recently announced its reopening on March 3rd, welcoming back guests with the poetic verses of Marin. With a focus on creating a heavenly experience through savory and roasted delicacies, Fish Restaurant Proto promises to offer an unforgettable dining experience for both locals and visitors alike.

sources.snippet: The Michelin-recommended Proto claims a tradition dating back to 1886, and it was here that Edward VIII entertained Wallis Simpson in the 1930s.
sources.shortName: The 51 best things to do in Dubrovnik

places.name: Fish Restaurant Proto

reviews.text: Visited in early spring (low season - April). A few tables of patrons. We were served dearly & simply the best dinner in Dubrovnik. Every dish was served with utmost delicacy & our favourite was the foie gras, smooth, buttery and literally melted in the mouth. Secondly was the mushroom & truffle pasta, creamy and mushroomy. Last but not least, the octopus tentacles were chewy & cooked to perfection. Sparkling wine was the greatest touch of all. All in all, we had a pleasant meal in Proto fish restaurant!

A truly memorable lunch in the heart of Dubrovnik's Old Town! The setting is elegant and peaceful, the service attentive and professional, and the food… simply outstanding. The baked octopus was incredibly fresh, perfectly tender, and beautifully presented with refined sides. We also really appreciated the staff's recommendations for both wine and dishes.

A big thank you to the entire team for such a high-quality experience - a must-visit for seafood lovers and anyone looking for an exceptional Mediterranean lunch in Dubrovnik!

Follow for more tips on Instagram @teslamag_travel

Proto – Worth Coming Back For
Proto is amazing – we loved it so much we came here twice in a row! The truffle croquettes and lobster pasta are absolute must-tries. The black ink risotto was good as well, though a little heavy on the tomatoes for my taste. Overall, a wonderful dining experienc

places.generalDescription: Plaža Danče, also known as Danče Beach, is a hidden gem favored by locals in Dubrovnik. Tucked away down a small track, this rocky shore offers privacy and tranquility for those seeking a peaceful seaside retreat. The deep waters are perfect for swimming and snorkeling, while the ancient church of Sv Marija nearby adds a touch of history to the visit.

sources.snippet: Adventurers will surely like the rocky Danče beach, which is located not far from the Old Town, below Gradac Park. Jumping from 30-meter-high cliffs will raise the adrenaline of anyone who dares to do so. In addition, you can play soccer or water polo with the locals on the beach.
sources.siteName: Explore Dubrovnik | Private Boat Tours Dubrovnik | Rent a Boat Dubrovnik
sources.shortName: 5 Romantic Things to do in Dubrovnik

sources.snippet: Croatia is famous for its clear sea and the beaches in Dubrovnik are pretty as a picture. Enjoy some fun activities such as scuba diving or taking a kayaking tour. Or just do the classic romantic thing – lay on the beach sipping cocktails looking at the sunset.
sources.siteName: Puzzle Punks - Escape Boredom! Fun is our business
sources.shortName: Dubrovnik for couples: discover spectacular romatic places
15 Best Romantic Things to Do in Dubrovnik for Couples

places.name: Plaža Danče / Danče Beach

reviews.text: The water was really nice, and as a fan of rock beaches compared to sand beaches, it was definitely my all-time favorite beach! Myriad of fish with a gorgeous rainbow fish that I think was an Ornate Wrasse, but I'm still unsure...  I would definitely recommend this to everyone except anyone who doesn't know how to swim. It is very deep from the very beginning, so there are no shallow areas for beginner swimmers.
Visited during spring time. Lovely & quiet spot to enjoy sunset. Rock beach ⛱️ should be quite a hyped spot during summer, free shower & plenty of space to sunbath.

Beautiful beach area not far out of the city with many areas to sit and enjoy the sun and swim.

About a 15 minute walk from the Pile Gate, along the water to a fantastic swimming and sunning area.  Many flat places to sit or lay on a towel along with rocky areas that provide places to sit or jump off the rocks into the water.

The views are amazing, quite a different area than the crowded downtown center.

If you are in town for a few days and need a break, take the walk to Dance Beach, it's worth the walk

places.generalDescription: Nestled in the vibrant heart of Dubrovnik's Old Town, Zuzori is a culinary gem that redefines Mediterranean dining. This chic and intimate restaurant showcases a modern twist on traditional flavors, emphasizing fresh, local ingredients in every dish. From delectable seafood to gourmet meats and vibrant vegetable options, Zuzori offers an exceptional gastronomic experience that caters to both casual diners and those celebrating special moments.

sources.snippet: ZUZORI is cozy alfresco restaurant in the Old Town of Dubrovnik. The imaginative menu boasts fresh Adriatic seafood as well as pastas, light salads and vegetarian dishes made with a great modern twist and of only the freshest and the finest ingredients.
sources.shortName: Romantic | Dubrovnik Eats

places.name: Zuzori

reviews.text: Loved this place and our waiter was so nice. Croatian food was delicious paired with Croatian wine. Pricing was also very good for the quality you are receiving. I would say that the bread they give you is also amazing. I'm not really a bread eater but it was so good I had 7 pieces with olive oil. Such a good place.

Nice and calm restaurant in the center of Dubrovnik's old town. My pasta with truffle was amazing, the portion was perfect and the relation quality price is correct. We asked for the lava chocolate dessert and we really enjoyed it. Even if it was in city center it was not that crowded and we were able to discuss calmly.

Amazing food, served on time. The receptionist was kind and lovely. Our waiter Mirko was fast and gentle. Drinks are also very good. It's a bit on the expensive side, but it's been recommended by the Michelin Guide since 2018.
